page.title: 15AMPORT VILLAGE GREEN.
page.content: Amport Village Green is the heart of the village. On one side a line of alder trees hide a small, muddy river while on the other a road skirts the Green wirh a row of beautiful thatched cottages beyond it. At one end there is a climbing frame shaped like a flying bug, a see-saw and swings. There are benches under the alder trees and a fallen trunk on which children play. Fetes are held on the Green as well as barbecues and a bonfire on the 5th November. Young people play football and cricket there; the Youth Club plays rounders and the school holds May Day Festivities, Easter Bunny Hunts and Sports. The annual Country Dance Festival in June brought together 35 schools this year and over 900 children danced on the Green. Villagers exercise their dogs there.
